introduction:
The Basic Electrical Science Virtual Lab is designed to provide students with a fundamental understanding of electrical concepts through interactive virtual experiments. This lab serves as a foundation for students pursuing engineering, physics, and related technical disciplines. It enables learners to explore electrical theories, circuit analysis, and component behavior in a simulated environment, eliminating the need for physical hardware while maintaining the hands-on experience of practical learning.
The virtual lab covers key topics such as Ohm’s Law, Kirchhoff’s Laws, AC/DC circuits, electrical measurements, and power calculations. Through simulations, students can design and analyse circuits, measure voltage, current, and resistance, and understand real-world electrical applications. This interactive platform enhances conceptual understanding, improves problem-solving skills, and bridges the gap between theory and practical application.By leveraging the advantages of virtual labs, students can conduct experiments anytime and anywhere, promoting flexible and self-paced learning. The Basic Electrical Science Virtual Lab aims to provide an immersive, engaging, and efficient learning experience, preparing students for more advanced studies in electrical engineering and related fields.

experiments.name: To Study and Verify the Kirchhoff Law
To Study and Measure the Power Factor of an Electrical Load
To Study and Verify the Network Theorem
To Study and Measure the Power Consumed by Three Phase Resistive Load by Two Wattmeter Method
To Study and Measure the Voltage, Current, Power, and Power Factor in Series RLC Circuit
To Study and Measure the Voltage, Current, Power, and Power Factor in Parallel RLC Circuit
To Study the Efficiency of Single Phase Transformer by Load Test
To Study the Torque-Speed Characteristics of Three Phase Induction Motor
To Determine the Resonance Frequency in a Series RLC Circuit

objective:
Students will be able to learn
  • Various electrical laws and principle associated with electrical system.
  • The fundamental of designing and operation of electrical machines
